meanings.definition: To unyoke or unharness (animals) from a wagon or vehicle.
meanings.sent1: After a long journey, the farmer outspans the tired horses from the wagon.
meanings.sent2: The cowboys outspans the oxen after reaching the ranch.
meanings.sent3: The horses were relieved when the farmer decided to outspans them from the heavy wagon.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the tired travelers outspans their horses, letting them rest.
meanings.sent5: The act of outspansing the horses was a welcome break from the bumpy ride.

meanings.definition: To stop and make camp while traveling.
meanings.sent1: The explorers outspans near the river to set up their tents for the night.
meanings.sent2: The nomads outspans in the desert to rest and cook dinner.
meanings.sent3: The family decided to outspans under the stars, enjoying the peaceful night.
meanings.sent4: The travelers outspans at the foot of the mountain, ready to continue their journey in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The group outspans in the meadow, surrounded by the beauty of nature.
